snippet: As the 2013 budget threatens to revive posturing over Medicare, some House Republicans also want to cut discretionary spending below levels agreed to in July’s debt limit deal.
abstract: House Republicans, waiting for the 2013 budget plan to be unveiled, are divided, with conservatives pushing to cut spending below the level both parties agreed to in the July 2011 federal debt limit deal, while moderates urge sticking with the agreement struck with Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: As the 2013 budget threatens to revive posturing over Medicare, some House Republicans also want to cut discretionary spending below levels agreed to in July’s debt limit deal.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Split Over Bid to Revise Budget Deal
headline.main: G.O.P. Split Over a Bid to Revise Budget Deal
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Split Over a Bid To Revise Budget Deal
